node.text:
If you’re anything like me then you enjoy a good old fashioned dynastic mystery series – the intrigue, the glamour, the betrayals, and the family tensions... Well, today I invite you to discover a fragrance family quite unlike any other and where nothing is quite as it seems... Penhaligon’s Portraits is a wittily named and beautifully presented collection of enticingly glamorous scents.  A tribute to those good old English eccentric, spirited characters that we recognise so well: stiff upper lip, caustic humour, and a knack for provocation... But which fragrance would you choose..?
@penhaligons_london
#penhaligonslondon #penhaligonsportraits

Flora: https://www.penhaligons.com/uk/en/product/the-ingenue-cousin-flora-000000000065145367

Helen: https://www.penhaligons.com/uk/en/product/heartless-helen-000000000065150237_1

William: https://www.penhaligons.com/uk/en/categories/fragrances/new/the-inimitable-mr-penhaligon-000000000065164054

Clara: https://www.penhaligons.com/uk/en/product/clandestine-clara-000000000065121096_1

Lady Blanche: https://www.penhaligons.com/uk/en/product/the-revenge-of-lady-blanche-000000000065121093

node.text:
It is a truth I must confess that when I’m hanging out a dress
I like the smell to be delightful, 
Always natural - nothing frightful

No nonsense, practical and plain, 
My focus must stay with the stain
Of course, I like it to look chic, 
The shelf appeal cannot be weak.

But what of cashmere, wool and mohair
And the things that take the most care?
No need to chemically dry clean -
Just wash by hand or home machine.

The stain solution will come first applying straight upon the spot
Say no to smells with scented vinegar - a soak will help a lot

Reversing items stops the fading, 
Then we bathe within a sink…
Ensuring temperatures are cool and all your colours are in synch.

Rinse through and press out excess water - never wring and never pull,
Allow to dry upon a towel, laying flat protects our wool, 

To speed the process roll up gently 
In same towel if needs be,
Safe in the knowledge that your woolens are phosphate and cruelty free 

Then we steam out any wrinkles 
And store folded good as new.
Take The ‘Dry’ out of your cleaning, From @TheLaundress, just for you. 💕
•
•
Poem & film by @hillhousevintage 

Take 25% off @TheLaundress laundry and home cleaning solutions and get a free 8oz bottle of their new Artisan Signature Detergent with purchase. Ends 2/28.

node.text:
“Animals are such agreeable friends. They ask no questions, they pass no criticisms” George Elliot 

I was never the model of course, but my old working life was in fashion, and I always think that this title sentence sums up the turn my life has taken over the past decade!  My daily walks with Coco have lifted me out of many low moments this year, come rain or shine, and although I still love to dress up, you’re now more likely to find me with wellies paired with the frocks... Anyway - my husband, (having finally admitted defeat and acknowledged that I’m actually in love with my dog 😂) asked me to send him a few clips of film that I’d taken on various walks and then he recorded me answering a few questions.  Today he sent me this video as an ode to my love for Coco and I felt that it was too sweet not to share. I hope that you like it too. xx

#dog #dogsofinstagram #countrylife

node.text:
When the cold nights draw in, and the whisper of Christmas sparks magic, Cath Kidston transforms into a gifting emporium!  We might not always be able to spend time with our loved ones, but we can certainly show them that they’re on our minds by sending them something special! Thoughtful gifts to show that despite being apart, this Christmas they’ll be closer than ever in our hearts. Join me and sign your gifts ‘with love’, ‘I’ve missed you’ and ‘See you soon’!
#Homeforchristmas
@cathkidston 

https://www.cathkidston.com/en-gb/christmas/?utm_source=instagram&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=hill_house_home_for_christmas

Filming & poem @hillhousevintage 
Editing by @georgia_furness

node.title: AD| Welcome To The @cathkidston Gift Emporium!

node.text: THIS IS 52!! 12 months older, at least 12 pounds heavier, a little bit wiser and still addicted to cake and champagne… May the best things in life never change and may the most enjoyable pursuits (baking, eating, cooking, drinking …) continue to make their presence known by giving people more of me to cuddle. Cheers to YOU and Happy Birthday to me! 💕🍾🥂😘xxx

node.text:
AD | Hunting down the Summer sun is a bit of a national sport for us here in the UK. I have sunhats, a picnic basket and deck chairs ready for action at all times during the Summer months – all ready for that mad dash out to catch some warming rays. However, even the best laid plans will often fall victim to the changeable British weather so it’s always a good idea to have a back-up plan. Whether you’re at the seaside, holidaying in a tent or sheltering in your own garden, you and your family can use SKY Go on two extra devices to pass the time wherever you are in the UK, which means that I can find catch up or stream live to find my Place in The Sun after all!
@SkyTV #SkyGo #skyfamilyuk #skygoonthego

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Paula Sutton on September 04, 2021. May be an image of 1 person, standing, flower and outdoors.

node.text: A throwback picture to a time when I was visiting open gardens and nosing around old houses on a regular basis. Always very inspiring and grounding to tread garden paths where many have come and gone for centuries before us.  I’ve been out of the habit of seeking out beautiful architecture and visiting stately gardens for a while - for obvious reasons of course- but looking back at old photos reminds me how much I love these country house jaunts and escapades, so I’ll be endeavouring to go back to showing more country house tours and visits  from now on. Happy Saturday! 🌸x

node.text:
Don’t mind me - I’m just tap dancing my demons away!! I’ve mentioned before how rediscovering my love of dressing up and enjoying clothes brought me immense joy following  a dark period of hiding myself away and trying to blend into the background…  Well, perhaps as an antidote to the current horror and sadness in the news, combined with losing Coco and with the added let down of the decidedly lacklustre August weather, I’m back out in full force dressing up for no particular reason again!  This 1930’s inspired dress made me think of those ‘all singing all dancing’ Hollywood films featuring Ginger Rogers and Fred Astaire - and that in turn of course made me want to dance (..even though my knees were begging me to stop!!) Some clothes are made to be worn joyfully. They are the outfits that help clear away the gloomy cobwebs and have a swish that begs to be danced in - and who am I to fight it!! Happy Sunday and I recommend that you get those feet tapping to fight away the gloom too! 😂💃🏽🌸xx
•
•
•
Dress: @needleandthreadlondon 
Shoes: @prada 
Blooms: @theflowerbx 
Rhythm: From my parents! 😉🤣

node.text:
If the Georgians had made a version of MTV’s ‘Welcome to My Crib’ would this be what it looked like? 😂

This morning, as we were in the area, we tried our luck with an impromptu visit to @peckoverhouseandgarden , but alas we were only able to visit the gardens (remember to check if pre-booking is still necessary for the @nationaltrust ladies & gents as each house is different!) However, a delightful - if quick - time was had, and I came away feeling inspired and filled with sumptuous planting ideas which is always my hope anyway.  By the way, to those who will ask…yes - this is a normal outfit for me - I’m not in fancy dress!! Happy Friday! 😂❤️xxx
#neverknowinglyunderdressed

node.text:
…And just like that, I found my smile again!
The universe has a habit of giving us balance - rough sits beside smooth, tears tangled up with laughter…
Some of you may know that I last saw my father in March 2020. I left Grenada a few weeks after my mother’s funeral, fully intending to see him again a couple of months at the most later. Well…as you know - THAT particular plan didn’t materialise and I walked straight off the plane and into lockdown. 
Eighteen months later, he’s arrived just when I needed him the most. Ladies and gentlemen, may I introduce you to ‘Grandpa Hill House’. The original all smiling, all dancing, dapper dressing, positive thinking member of the family. If you ever need to know how I always manage to look on the bright side, see my cup half fulleth, or continue to search for the light and beauty beyond even the darkest clouds, then here’s your answer. (He’s also the reason why I can sing you a jazz tune and a country & western ballad in the same breath! 😆) Have  the happiest of Fridays all - and remember to give a squeeze and a cuddle to the ones you love! 💕🌸xx

node.text:
Whenever I post anything personal on here and particularly when it covers the subject matter of grief and loss, I am so grateful to be met with so much love and compassion, but equally moved by the comments from people who are experiencing the same thing, are still in the the deep throes of grief or are still grieving for losses of the past.  Whether the grief is for a person, the loss of ones health, a faithful companion, or the shattered dream of the life path that you thought you were on - I read every single one of your messages and I am honoured to be entrusted with your stories. 

It’s a great reminder to us all that behind the smiley faces, the beautiful gardens, the thoughtfully curated homes, and the cheeky flick of a dress, there are a million hidden stories of personal challenge and loss. 
I just want to say thank you,  I’m so desperately sorry for what you may be going through right now or have gone through in the past. I’m sending you a virtual hug, and I promise that I’ll do my best to help you (and myself) keep on smiling.  Happy Sunday. ❤️⭐️ 
•
(The second image of Coco and I twinning a few years ago is one that  I have returned to several times over the past few days as it’s always made me laugh - people really do begin to resemble their dogs it seems! 🐶😆💕)

node.text:
Goodnight to my darling girl. My faithful companion, My partner in cake themed crime. My chocolate bundle of gorgeousness. My heart is broken but my beautiful memories are intact. 💔

Signing off for a few days. I won’t be answering your messages for a while - I hope that you don’t mind. x

node.text:
The ‘OFFICIAL COVER REVEAL’!! 😆🎉🎉🎉
It’s the image that most people now associate with me and Hill House, so of course a version of it had to make it on to the cover of my book! To me the image signifies joy and happiness and finding a little pocket of peace in an otherwise ‘noisy’ world - and that’s what the book is all about!
Thanks to both @ninafuga for the illustration and @jimmylazergram for Art Direction, and of course the lovely @simonbrownphotography for capturing Hill House beautifully for the book. 

‘Hill House Living - The Art of Creating A Joyful Life’ is available to Pre-order now using the link in my bio, and will be out on October 14th in the UK published by @eburybooks and October 19th in the US published by @clarksonpotter . Happy Friday! 📚💕💕💕⭐️
